descriptionHtml:
Welcome,this is my first mod,hope you\'ll try it and give me some feedback!

DESCRIPTION:
I always felt like as if the food and drinks in Skyrim were a bit underestimated, i mean..
Who ever loot those things from chests or barrels?
So i thought to make a small mod that simulate the need to eat and drink.
Don\'t worry,it\'s NOT AN HARDCORE mod and the eating action is AUTOMATED so you
don\'t have to worry about entering in your inventory everytime,it will 
just make you want to bring some food and drinks with you during your adventures ^^
Basically this mod will add some buffers based on player\'s eating habits.
For your happiness you\'ll not have to manually eat something from the inventory,
just bring something with you and,3 times a day (i repeat,it\'s not an hardcore mode)
it will be automatically removed from your inventory.
The first day of that you will avoid eating or drinking you\'ll not receive any buffer,
neither good or bad ones,the negative buffers will start their effects after around 24-36 hours
and their effects will increase as you keep fasting.

You\'ll also receive some notification that remember your status (around 1 per meal)
I\'ve also used some ingame sound to simulate the hungry on your character and
i used a the \"paralyze\" visual effect for the negative buffer,and a \"restore stamina\" effect
for the bonus one.

NOTE: when receiving messages like \"you\'re hungry\" or \"you\'re getting hungry\"
(first 24-36 hours) no buffer is applied yet,it\'s just a reminder for you to eat

CHANGELOG 1.0a to 1.0b
-added 4 new buffers for different level of dehydratation
-added a visual effect that occours more frequently as you keep fasting/dehydratating starting from the second day
-use of the \"EquipItem\" function instead of the \"RemoveItem\" one
-Minor bug fixes 

Visual effect:
[youtube]tyEr_Q5onpg[/youtube]

Eating buffers:
-\"Well Fed\": you will receive this buffer after eating a meal and it will last for 12 hours.
Gives: 5% bonus to Health and Stamina regeneration
-\"Starvation Level 1\": after 24-36 hours
Gives: -10 to Max Health/Stamina and -2% of Health/Stamina regeneration
-\"Starvation Level 2\": after around 2 days
Gives: -25 to Max Health/Stamina and -5% of Health/Stamina regeneration
-\"Starvation Level 3\": after around 3 days
Gives: -50 to Max Health/Stamina and -10% of Health/Stamina regeneration
-\"Starvation Level 4\": after 4 days,it will last until you eat something
Gives: -75 to Max Health/Stamina and -20% of Health/Stamina regeneration

Ok,the last buffer could hit a bit hard on your performance but...come on,you had 4 days to eat! eheh

Drinking buffers:
-\"Fresh Feeling\": you will receive this buffer after drinking something at it will last for 12 hours
Gives: 5% bonus to Magicka regeneration
-\"Thirsty Level 1\": after 24-36 hours
Gives -10 Max Magicka and -3% to Magicka regeneration
-\"Thirsty Level 2\": after around 2 days
Gives -20 Max Magicka and -5% to Magicka regeneration
-\"Thirsty Level 3\": after around 3 days
Gives -40 Max Magicka ,-8% to Magicka regeneration and -5% to Stamina regeneration
-\"Thirsty Level 4\": after 4 days,it will last until you eat something
Gives -70 Max Magicka ,-15% to Magicka regeneration and -10% to Stamina regeneration


HOW TO INSTALL:
Download the file and put it into your Skyrim \"Data\" folder

FAQ:
-How do i eat/drink something?
Just keep some standard food and drink items in the inventory and they will be automatically
eaten periodically
-I manually ate/drunk something but the buffer won\'t go away
Manual eating/drinking will not work,only the automated consumed one will do the trick
-What food/drinks will work with this mod?
Basically every food listed at this page http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Food
-Do this mod have any requirement?
No,it will just eat also some Heartfire items like stews or soup if any.
-I have food in the inventory but the mod won\'t use it,why?
Well,not ALL food items are supported,but in this case usually the problem is
between certain hours when the script switches from \"breakfast/lunch/dinner\"
so the best thing is just wait an hour or two (both playing or using the wait function)

[URL=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=127878469]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=127878469[/URL]

Well,that\'s all for now ^^ hope you\'ll enjoy it!
